docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Works automatically with the XDAQ AIO
  • Record videos with embedded XDAQ metadata
  • Record M-JPEG encoded videos
  • Trigger recording from hardware TTL inputs or via Brainwave simulator

Note

  • Record H.265 encoded videos will be available soon
  • Synchronized recording with Open Ephys GUI and Intan RHX will be available soon

Support for macOS and Ubuntu will be available soon

docs.title: Deployment (coming soon)
docs.text:
To deploy the application, follow these instructions:

  1. Install dependencies using Conan: 

    conan install . -b missing -pr:a <profile> -s build_type=Release

  2. Generate the build files with a custom installation directory: 

    cmake -S . -B build/Release --preset conan-release -G "Ninja" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX="./<folder>"

  3. Build and package the application: 

    cmake --build build/Release --preset conan-release --target package

Note

Replace <profile> with the Conan profile from your environment and <folder> with your desired installation directory.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Welcome, Developers!

This guide will walk you through building and deploying the Thor Vision from source.

docs.title: Building from Source (coming soon)
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure the following tools and dependencies are installed on your system:

Build Tools:

  • CMake - A cross-platform build system generator
  • Ninja - A small build system with a focus on speed
  • Conan - A package manager for C++
  • Qt 6 - The GUI framework for the application

XDAQ Libraries:

  • libxvc - Required for streaming cameras
  • xdaqmetadata - Required for parsing XDAQ Metadata

Follow these steps to build the application from source:

  1. Install dependencies using Conan 

    conan install . -b missing -pr:a <profile> -s build_type=Release

  2. Generate the build files with CMake 

    cmake -S . -B build/Release --preset conan-release -G "Ninja" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release

  3. Build the project 

    cmake --build build/Release --preset conan-release

Note

Replace <profile> with the Conan profile from your environment

docs.title: Building the docs
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure the following tools are installed on your system:

  • Python
  • Material for MkDocs

First generate build files using cmake with the -DXVC_DOC=ON option enabled. Then build the target doc to generate HTML documentation in build/Release/doc-html:

cmake --build build/Release --preset conan-release --target doc

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Thor Vision is a GUI app designed for seamless control and video capture from USB cameras on the XDAQ AIO. This user manual provides instructions on how to use the features provided by the GUI application to communicate with the XDAQ AIO.

docs.title: Hardware Requirements
docs.text:
• PC: Windows with a Thunderbolt 3.0 port or higher.
  • XDAQ AIO.
  • Thunderbolt 3.0 Cable (or higher).
  • USB Cameras: Compatible with XDAQ.

Note

Support for macOS and Ubuntu will be available soon

docs.title: 1. Record
docs.text: Press the button to record videos with embedded XDAQ metadata.

docs.title: 2. Camera List
docs.text: View and live stream cameras on the XDAQ AIO.

docs.title: 3. Record Settings
docs.text: Open the record settings window for advanced configuration options.

docs.title: 1. Record Settings of Camera List
docs.text:
Choose either Continuous or Trigger on to record camera.

  • Continuous: Start recording by pressing the REC button.
  • Trigger on: Start recording based on external triggers from the Brainwave simulator.

docs.title: 2. Record Mode
docs.text:
Choose either Continuous or Split camera record into to record cameras.

  • Continuous: Record a single, uninterrupted video file for the entire recording session.
  • Split: Record multiple video files, each split into predefined segments (e.g., 5 seconds, 10 seconds).

docs.title: 3. Record Path/Folder Name
docs.text:
• Record Path: Click ... to select the folder for saving recordings, or manually enter the directory path.
  • Folder Name: Choose between:
    • Auto Automatically generated folder name in YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS format.
    • Custom: Specify a custom folder name.

docs.title: 4. Extract Metadata
docs.text: Enable this option to store XDAQ metadata in a separate file for post-processing.

docs.title: 1. Stream Window
docs.text: View live streams from cameras on the XDAQ AIO.

docs.title: 2. XDAQ Metadata
docs.text: Display live metadata from cameras on the XDAQ AIO.

docs.title: 1. Start/Stop Stream
docs.text: Start or Stop the live stream from the camera.

docs.title: 2. Resolution
docs.text: Select a compatible resolution for the camera.

docs.title: 3. FPS
docs.text: Select a compatible frame rate (FPS) for the camera.

docs.title: 4. Codec
docs.text:
Select a compatible codec for the camera.

Tip

Each camera has its own unique capabilities. Options for resolution, FPS, and codec that are slightly dimmed indicate that the currently selected camera does not support these settings. These options remain clickable, but selecting them will reset the current camera's settings.

docs.title: 5. View
docs.text: Toggle to show or hide the camera view.
